Review: A very NAISU (Nice) game. 8/10 Most of people think that Terraria is a survival game, but that's wrong: It's a adventure game. Let me explain this: In a survival game, the gameplay is focused in constantly making the game harder and forcing the player to search for new resources for surviving; for example, a hunger meter that depletes over time forces the player to constantly search for food, or tools that break when used too much times. In adventure games, the gameplay is focused in forcing the player to go forward and finish a main goal, in this case, defeating Cthulhu v2.0 (a.K.a. MoonLord). The game also makes the "surviving" easier or less important, because the main goal and the focus of the game aren't surviving, also making it a lot easier to reach the final goal.  Terraria makes the searching for resources a lot easier than most of survival games (probably because it's a 2D game), making it easy to advance in the game and of course reaching the final boss. Also, the "corrupt biomes" are a very interesting mechanic, motivating the players to go forward for being able to fight the evil properly, also forcing the players to go "faster" as the evil spreads around the world destroying everything in it's way. Invasions also are a very interesting mechanic, just imagine being building a house or trading with a NPC when suddenly you see a Goblin Army coming from west/east, or Martians using lasers and gigant robots for destroying every single life form in your world. Another thing that motivates the player to go forward, is the bosses. They are pretty strong monsters that you must beat in order to advance and getting very special rewards, such as new and powerfull materials, weapons, and armors. The OST fits the game very well; it could be better, but it's not bad, it is very good.  Thanks to you for reading, and thanks to RE-LOGIC for creating and sharing this game.  -Leo.

Review: Want the short answer? The game is definitely a must have! 10/10  The graphics/designs are really nice. - All the of the bosses look great and have iconic looks! Even the new DST crossover boss, Deerclops looks right at home! - There's also a ton of accessories, vanities, and dyes available throughout the whole game for you to customise your character!  The music is an absolute banger. - Every epic boss fight is accompanied by their own epic music! - I personally love the Empress of Light theme so much <3 I spent quite a while to beat her Daytime form that I just vibe with it at this point hahaha!  The replay value is very high. - I've played through the game multiple times with all the different classes available and it's still fun! It's not very hard to play on Expert/Master mode, actually makes beating the boss more satisfying and rewards you with more rare loots that aren't available in Classic mode. The game also makes grinding easier once you reach certain progression stages! - The game devs really love the game and keeps updating even though it's already the last final final update, with another one coming soon called the Labor of Love update lol xD - The community also shared a lot of love for this game and has a ton of really good content mods! I personally recommend trying "Calamity Mod" and "The Stars Above"!

Review: Terraria is probably the only game i'll ever make a review for. Why? Because this game is just so perfectly designed that every other game i've ever played just feels bland. Terraria is a 2D platformer which gets compared to minecraft often BEFORE people play it. But it is just incomparable to minecraft because it's a whole different genre. Minecraft is just about digging, surviving and building the progression is the ores you can mine. In terraria however your progression is made mostly by defeating bosses then mining, getting mob drops, fishing for loot crates, building houses for npc who can trade items/ammo/potions/etc with you, and even just exploring for chests that are all over the map. Terraria has SO MUCH content it's insane. For ‚Ç¨9,99 it's insane how much content you get and how much fun i've gotten for my money playing like 5+ playthroughs with friends and even more solo ( because i don't even have enough friends to play this game with ). I haven't found any game that comes even close to this games perfect design and i litterally can not give a solo/friend multiplayer game less than 10/10 when i have nearly 500 hours on it when it has this little cost.  PS: terraria alone is even not all there is to it. Not a lot of people know but you can mod the hell out of terraria. These mods go from simple things like a boss checklist or making you able to stack things to 9999 instead of 999 to adding a huge amount of new well designed content ( terraria's graphics are so good for mods. People can EASELY add new bosses items, while still easy to balance because of how terraria's system works ). There are several terraria modoverhauls the add 1000+ items and 10+bosses to terraria. They are even compatible with eachother so if you want one crazy playthrough you can add like 4-5 different full overhauls to your modlist.

Review: TL;DR 9/10 for sure!  If you enjoy sandbox RPG games then you'll love this one. Easily the KING of sandbox rpg games. Tons of cool features and spells, Weapons and armor.  Here's just a list of what I could pull from my head of pros and cons.  Pros: Cool Items Magic works in a neat way Bosses are challenging and fun to farm Has Expert mode (Even more items) Has a modding Community thats alive and well Tons of replayability and different play styles  Cons: Vanilla game once played alot can get stale Some bosses are OP Game is 32 bit. (Seriously devs add 64bit support please.) Game does not support IPV6 and as such can not host if you don't have dedicated IPV4. No Modding Support (Steam Workshop)  Overall with all the stuff in this game, It surprises me how after 400+hours i can still find things i never knew existed.  Plus with mods, It just adds even more content.  If you get this, I highly suggest you play it through to completion at least once before going to get mods.  And if you do get mods, Be sure to try ones like Calamity, Tremor, or better yet... Thorium.

Review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
